cyclone.name: IDALIA
cyclone.current_location: about 85 miles north of the western tip of Cuba and about 370 miles south-southwest of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north across the eastern Gulf of Mexico, then accelerating north-northeast toward the Florida Big Bend, crossing southeast Georgia and emerging off the Georgia–South Carolina coast into the western Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend (near the Cedar Key–Apalachee Bay area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Altamaha Sound GA northward to South Santee River SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Sebastian Inlet FL northward to Altamaha Sound GA (includes Port of Brunswick area)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida east coast north of Sebastian Inlet, the entire Georgia coast, and the South Carolina coast south of Charleston
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds likely (sustained 35–50 kt, gusts possibly to 60 kt) Wednesday afternoon through early Thursday
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft of inundation above ground level possible around Brunswick and adjacent tidal waterways at high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches with locally higher amounts up to 10 inches, producing flash and urban flooding potential
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes and dangerous rip currents/surf conditions
